subject: Programming
title: Dependency Injection
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Dependency Injection.

hook.text: A class that creates its own database connection can never be tested without a real database.

buildup.text: Dependency injection means passing dependencies in from outside instead of creating them inside.

discovery.text: Inject a fake database during tests, a real one in production. Same code, different behavior.

twist.text: Over-injecting creates constructor chaos â€” classes with ten parameters nobody understands.

climax.text: Inject what changes. Hard-code what doesn't. Balance beats dogma.

punchline.text: Give objects what they need. Don't let them find it.

quiz.question: What problem does dependency injection solve?
